name: Accelerated A+ (220-901 / 220-902)
subtitle: Vendor-neutral hardware and software technologies
description: Those looking to complete the CompTIA A+ 900 Series certification will find in this course an overview of the process in achieving the certification and details about the two exams required to pass in order to receive the certification. The certification is designed for entry level IT professionals with about a year of experience. Some of the exam objectives include hardware, networking, mobile devices, operating systems, security, and troubleshooting, making it a valuable certification to have especially for one just getting in to the IT career field with no documented experience.
descriptionMD: Those looking to complete the CompTIA A+ 900 Series certification will find in this course an overview of the process in achieving the certification and details about the two exams required to pass in order to receive the certification. The certification is designed for entry level IT professionals with about a year of experience. Some of the exam objectives include hardware, networking, mobile devices, operating systems, security, and troubleshooting, making it a valuable certification to have especially for one just getting in to the IT career field with no documented experience.

episodes.title: Windows Features and Installation
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore the Windows Operating System features and installation. Specific topics discussed includes: Architecture, Versions and Editions, and Features (Aero/Gadgets/Sidebar/UAC).

episodes.title: Windows Features and Installation Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore the Windows Operating System features and installation. Specific topics discussed includes: OS Features, specifically, BitLocker, System Restore, Ready Boost, Compatibility, Easy Transfer, Windows Firewall, Defender, Action Center, Security Center, Metro/Modern UI, Charms, OneDrive, and PowerShell/Command Prompt.

episodes.title: Windows Features and Installation Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore the Windows Operating System features and installation. Specific topics discussed includes: Boot Methods, Upgrade Types, Drivers, Updates, and Configuration.

episodes.title: Microsoft Command Prompt and Runline
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore the Command Prompt as well as Runline commands found in the Windows Operating System. Specific topics covered includes: Running cmd.exe as standard user vs. Administrator, getting help (/?), TASKLIST, TASKKILL, DIR, CD/MD/RD, COPY/DEL, XCOPY/ROBOCOPY, DISKPART, FORMAT, REGEDIT, SERVICES.MSC, MMC, MSTSC, MSINFO, DXDIAG and DEFRAG.

episodes.title: Windows Tools and Control Panel
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look at Windows Administrative Tools and the Control Panel. Specific topics covered here includes: Computer Management, Task Scheduler, Print Management, Windows Firewall, Local users and groups, Services, MSCONFIG, Internet Options, Folder Options, System, Programs and Features, Devices and Printers, Power options, Sound, and Network & Sharing Center.

episodes.title: Windows Client Networking
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look into client networking inside the Windows Operating System. Here they will explore networking topics like Homegroup, Workgroups, and Domains, Network/Administrative shares and drive mapping, networked printers, network connections (Wired/Cellular), proxy settings, remote desktop, and remote assistance.

episodes.title: Windows Disk Management
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore managing disk drives in the Windows Operating System. Here they will cover management using Disk Management vs DISKPART, partitioning schemes, formatting, file systems, and maintenance.

episodes.title: Virtualization and Cloud Concepts
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes take a look into Virtualization and Cloud Concepts. Specific topics covered here includes: Virtual Machines, Hypervisors, Virtual networking types, Virtual security, Cloud services (SaaS/IaaS,PaaS), Elasticity, Resource pooling, Measured Service, and Cloud Models (Public, Private, Hybrid, and Community).

episodes.title: Network Hosts and Services
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore the different types of network hosts and services covered in the A+ exams. Specific topics covered here includes: File Transfer(FTP), Web services(HTTP), Email(SMTP/POP3/IMAP), Authentication(Kerberos), Proxy, DNS, and Print. They also discuss devices like IPS/IDS, UTM, IoT, and SCADA.

episodes.title: Mobile Devices
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes give you the necessary information concerning Mobile Devices for the A+ exam. Specific topics covered here includes: Mobile OS types, Launchers and GUIs, Virtual Assistants, Apps, and Features.

episodes.title: Mobile Devices Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes give you the necessary information concerning Mobile Devices for the A+ exam. Specific topics covered here includes: More Features like Airplane Mode, Cellular/Wireless/Bluetooth connections, IMEI/IMSI/PRL, Hotspots/Tethering, VPNs, Mobile payment services, and Security measures like Screen locks, Remote wiping, Locater Apps, Patching, Policies, etc.

episodes.title: Mobile Device Data and Syncing
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes take a look at mobile device data and syncing that data. Here they explore the types of data on mobile devices (email/apps/pictures/music/etc), Sync locations, Single Sign-On(SSO) implementations, and connection types.

episodes.title: Other Mobile Device Technologies
episodes.description: Wes and Zach look at mobile device technologies, different types of mobile devices, ports, bluetooth, IR, hotspot/tethering, and accessories.

episodes.title: Threats, Vulnerabilities and Prevention
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes cover common threats and vulnerabilities that are lurking in the shadows of the internet, waiting to cause harm to our systems. These include Malware(spyware/viruses/worms/trojans/rootkits/ransomware), phishing, spoofing, and impersonation. Then they walk you through common methods of prevention which help us keep the bad guys at bay.

episodes.title: Workstation and Windows Security
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look into generic workstation security as well as Windows OS specific security. Here they cover topics like Passwords; both policies and enforcement, Account management, encryption, patch management, Windows users and groups, filesystem/share permissions, system files and folders, and Single Sign-On(SSO).

episodes.title: Data Destruction
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes describe common data destruction concepts and practices. Specific topics covered here includes: Physical destruction by shredders, drills, hammers, degaussers, and/or incineration; Recycling and/or repurposing best-practices (low-level vs. standard formatting, overwrites, and drive wipes).

episodes.title: Securing SOHOs
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore securing a Small Office/Home Office(SOHO) environment. Specific topics covered here includes: Wireless specific security, Changing default username/password, MAC filtering, Using static IP addresses, Firewall settings, Port Forwarding, Disabling ports, Content filtering, Parental Controls, Firmware updates, and Physical security.

episodes.title: Troubleshooting PC OS Issues
episodes.description: Wes and Zach talk about troubleshooting PC OS issues common symptoms, shutdown issues, boot issues, device fails to start/detected, missing DLL message, service fails to start (Event Viewer & Logs, Comp. Management, Services), compatibility error, slow system performance (DEFRAG-SFC), file fails to open, multiple monitor misalignment/orientation, and tools such as BIOS/UEFI, REGSRV32, REGEDIT, plus uninstall/reinstall/Repai.

episodes.title: Troubleshooting PC Security Issues
episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss troubleshooting PC security issues common symptoms, browser based issues, email based issues, system based issues, file system based issues, and the best practice for malware removal.

episodes.title: Mobile OS, App and Security Issues
episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss Mobile OS App & Security Issues, common symptoms communications, display issues, the system, tools to reset factory default, security issues, and tools including Uninstall & Reinstall apps.

episodes.title: Safety Procedures and Environmental Controls
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes discuss using proper safety procedures and environmental controls. Specific topics covered here includes: Electrical grounding tools and techniques, Toxic Waste handling, Personal safety, regulations compliance, MSDS documentation, Power protection, and Environmental control.

episodes.title: Privacy, Licensing and Policy
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore privacy, licensing, and other policies. Specific topics covered includes: Incident Response, Digital Rights Management, End User License Agreements(EULA), Personally Identifiable Information(PII), and corporate end-user policies/security best-practices.

episodes.title: Communication and Professionalism
episodes.description: Wes and Zach talk about communication & professionalism in the IT environment, using proper language, maintaining a positive attitude, actively listen, being culturally sensitive, being on time, avoiding distractions, dealing with difficult customers or situations, social media etiquette, setting & meeting expectations, documentation, customer follow up, and dealing appropriately with customers confidential private materials.

episodes.title: Troubleshooting Theory
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes walk through troubleshooting theory covered in the A+ exam. The specific troubleshooting steps covered includes: Identifying the problem, Establishing a theory of probably cause, Test the theory to determine cause, Establish a plan to resolve the problem and implement the solution, Verify full system functionality and implement preventative measures if possible, and Document findings, actions, and outcomes.

episodes.title: TCP/IP Properties and Ports
episodes.description: Wes and Zach talk about TCP/IP Properties & Ports, addressing, and name resolution.

episodes.title: TCP/IP Properties and Ports Part 2
episodes.description: Wes and Zach continue the discussion regarding TCP/IP Properties & Ports, IPv4 vs. IPv6, Public vs. Private, Ports/Protocols & Services, and corresponding port numbers with services-Please note AFP is located at port 548.

episodes.title: Wireless and SOHOs
episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss wireless and SOHO standards, encryption types, and wireless configuration.

episodes.title: Cabling and Connectors
episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss various cabling and connector options/uses, Fiber-single vs. multimode, Twisted Pair-UTP vs. STP, speed & transmission limitations, splitters & effects on signal quality, connector choices, coaxial-RG-6 vs. RG-59 plus coaxial connectors.

episodes.title: Network Devices and Tools
episodes.description: Wes and Zach cover different devices, Hub, Switch, Router, Access Point, Bridge, Modem, Firewall, Patch Panel, Repeaters/Extenders, Ethernet over power/power over Ethernet injector, and tools including Crimper, Cable Stripper, Multimeter, Tone Generator/Probe, Cable Tester, Loopback Plug, Punchdown Tool, plus WiFi Analyzer.

episodes.title: Internet Connections and Network Types
episodes.description: Wes and Zach cover various connection types discussing Cable-DSL-Dial-Up-Fiber-Satellite-ISDN-Cellular-Tethering-Mobile Hot-Spot & Line of sight wireless Internet service, and Network types including LAN-WAN-PAN and MAN.

episodes.title: BIOS and UEFI Configuration
episodes.description: Wes and Zach talk over what BIOS & UEFI are, BIOS/UEFI configuration, Firmware upgrades, BIOS component information, diagnostics, security, encryption, enabling & disabling devices, virtualization support, monitoring, and more.

episodes.title: Motherboards and PSUs
episodes.description: Wes and Zach cover Motherboards & PSU's, sizes, expansion slots, power, cooling, chipsets, bus speeds, connector types, PSU specifications, and more.

episodes.title: RAM and CPUs
episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss Ram &CPU's, RAM types, parity vs. non-parity, ECC vs. non-ECC, RAM configurations, CPU's, socket types, characteristics overview, and cooling.

episodes.title: Storage Technologies
episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss storage technologies, optical drives, magnetic hard disk drives, hot swappable drives, solid state/flash drives, RAID, tape drive, and media capacity.

episodes.title: PC Connections and Cables
episodes.description: Wes and Zach cover PC connections & cables, physical connections, wireless connections, characteristics, adapters and convertors.

episodes.title: Expansion Cards and Peripherals
episodes.description: Wes and Zach look at expansion cards & peripherals, types of expansion cards, assorted peripherals, output devices, and input devices.

episodes.title: SOHO Setup
episodes.description: Wes and Zach cover SOHO setup including device sharing-wired-wireless-integrated print server-cloud printing-remote printing-public/shared devices, and data privacy.

episodes.title: Printers and Maintenance
episodes.description: Wes and Zach look at printers & maintenance, printer technologies, components, imaging processes, maintenance issues, different types of printers, and virtual printers.

episodes.title: Display Devices
episodes.description: Wes and Zach cover Display Devices types, TFT = Thin Film Translator, refresh/frame rates, resolution, Native resolution, brightness/lumens, analog vs. digital, privacy/antiglare filters, multiple displays, and aspect ratios.

episodes.title: Custom PCs
episodes.description: Wes and Zach talk about custom PC's, graphic/CAD/CAM design workstations, audio/video editing workstation, virtualization workstation, gaming PC's, home theater PC, standard 'Thick' client, 'Thin' client,

episodes.title: Laptop Hardware and Features
episodes.description: Wes and Zach cover laptop hardware & features, expansion options, hardware/device replacement, special function keys, docking station, physical laptop lock & cable lock, rotating removable screens, types of screens/displays, WiFi antenna connector/placement, webcam, microphone, inverter, and digitizer.

episodes.title: Troubleshooting Mobos, RAM, CPUs and Power
episodes.description: Wes and Zach look at troubleshooting Mobos-RAM-CPU's & PSU's, looking at common symptoms, unexpected shutdowns/system lockups/POST code beeps/blank screen on boot/BIOS time & settings resets, attempts to boot to incorrect device/continuous reboots/no power/overheating/loud noise/Intermittent device failure/fans spin/no power to other devices/Indicator lights/smoke/burning smell/proprietary crash screens (BSOD-pin wheel), and tools.

episodes.title: Troubleshooting Hard Drives and RAID Arrays
episodes.description: Wes and Zach look at troubleshooting hard drives & raid arrays looking at common symptoms, read-write failure/slow performance/loud clicking noise/failure to boot/drive not recognized, OS not found/RAID not found/RAID stops working/propriety crash screens (BSOD-pin wheel)/S.M.A.R.T. errors/and tools.

episodes.title: Troubleshooting Display and Video
episodes.description: Wes and Zach cover troubleshooting display & video including common symptoms in VGA mode/when there is no image on screen/overheat shutdown/dead pixels/artifacts/color patterns incorrect/dim image/flickering image/distorted image/distorted geometry/burn-in/and oversized images & icons.

episodes.title: Troubleshooting Networking
episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss common symptoms of Network trouble, hardware tools, and command line tools including PING-IPCONFIG/IFCONFIG-TRACERT-NETSTAT-NBTSTAT-NET-NETDOM and NSLOOKUP.

episodes.title: Troubleshooting Printers
episodes.description: Wes and Zach look at troubleshooting different types of printers & printing devices, common symptoms/possible problem areas, emphasis on simple solutions first, emphasis on safety first, and tools & techniques we can use.
